meanings.definition: To make a promise that exceeds or surpasses another promise.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outpromise her friends by offering more than they do.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outpromise his colleagues when it comes to completing tasks.
meanings.sent3: The competition between the two siblings led them to outpromise each other on chores.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to outpromise others in generosity made her stand out in the community.
meanings.sent5: In order to outpromise his competitors, he offered a deal they couldn't refuse.

meanings.sent1: The salesman would always outpromise his customers to make a sale.
meanings.sent2: It's not wise to constantly outpromise and underdeliver in business.
meanings.sent3: The politician's habit of outpromising without follow-through became a running joke.
meanings.sent4: She learned the hard way that it's better to deliver on promises than to outpromise and disappoint.
meanings.sent5: His tendency to outpromise without considering his capabilities often led to failure.
